comment: Purchased two 12 month PS Plus subscription voucher codes and used one at that time, then held the other for possible gift or to use later.  When I attempted to activate second voucher code it had been cancelled and Amazon refused to provide any assistance, instead requiring multiple calls to Sony and long hold times. I have now submitted a copy of the e-mail I got from Amazon to Sony support and hopefully the will reactivate the code or give me a new one, but if not it appears I have no other recourse.  If Amazon sells a product, they need to be able to resolve issues and not just finger point and pass the buck.  Very frustrating and disappointing.
Pretty simple, I paid for the code, put it in, "The code you entered is inactive.  Please check terms and conditions."Love to press the buy button and have money disappear then get nothing.

Hi, i just bought a code and it doesn't work, when i try to redeem the code give the next message "The code you entered may not be correct or may no longer be valid. Please check your entry" so need help or my money back,

My PlayStation 4 is a year old now and this is my second time purchasing a PS Plus code from this site. Last year, I bought a code during Black Friday and as soon as I boot up the console, I entered the code and it worked. One year later and for some reason, the code doesn't go through. I entered the 12 digit code from my PlayStation and I got the green check meaning I did everything right. However, my PS Plus didn't extend. To make matters worse, it doesn't work when I enter the code from the store's website and this was after entering it from the store via my console.As I'm typing this, my membership expired this week and I'm out $39.99 (plus tax). I doubt I can get a refund now and because of this, I don't think I can trust this site to provide me with PS Plus codes. I refuse to go through that again in 2019.

After purchasing, I immediately entered the code on my PS4 and it didn't work.  I tried it a few more times and still no luck.  After troubleshooting for maybe 15 minutes, I tried it again and it worked.  I believe it takes 10-20 minutes for Sony to register the newly generated code after purchasing it from Amazon. If the code doesn't immediately work for you, wait 20 minutes and try again.
Immediately received activation code and was able to add a year to my PSN account.  Got it for the $39 cyber monday deal.  I am giving it 3 stars though, because $59 is a ripoff.

The product(playstation Plus membership card) itself is fine. Digital code worked flawlessly. However since I've been a playstation plus members I've noticed the benefits and content has been less and the specials dont seem to come as often or to be the higher quality games. I may give it another month or so but if it stays the same I will most likely discontinue my membership. If you use PS3 system they will be discontinuing support for in the near future from my understanding. Which is a shame due to so many out there that still utilize that very capable and enjoyable system.

Have been a PlayStation Plus member for years, but this one I bought for my son as a gift.  Much more affective than just adding it by credit card on his account because we printed out the graphic and put it in a card for him and he was able to add it to his own account.  Made it feel more real to him.  PlayStation Plus is well worth it.  Some of my favorite games were free from PS Plus.  Well worth it for the benefits.

Worked perfectly fine. Most of these people rating low stars don’t even know how to follow simple instructions and seem like they don’t even understand how digital codes work. I bought it while I was on my way home from work. 20 minutes after my purchase I redeemed the code on my PS4 and guess what? It worked!Everything was smooth as butter and no issues here.

I don't hate anything but since Amazon's rating stars equate hate to the lowest grade, this was the only available option.It is the Playstation policy of ultra adherence to it's "transfer" rule, that I have a problem with. As concise as I can make this, PS will not accept my voucher because I bought  this from Amazon with My credit card. My husband then entered the # into my underage grandson's acct. which has My Husband's email address. My name is also on the account because PS required TWO signatures to allow my grandson to open the acct.  Well it seems that because my email address and my husband's address are not exactly the same, the voucher was denied. At least, I think that's the issue. PS has a VERY LONG policy list that is confusing at times and needlessly inclusive, almost everything under the sun.

I am no expert with electronics but I am also no dummy!  I got the code for this product, I gave it to my son on Christmas morning as one of his gifts and it actually turned out to be on his top 3 list!  He was ecstatic which made me very happy HOWEVER ... when I loaded it onto his account I made a small mistake, I put my hands up and own that it was my mistake...it seems I added it to my parent account which is linked to Amazon instead of his account which is linked to mine.That should be an easy fix I thought!  A quick phone call to Playstation (a global organization).  That should be as easy as transferring it within accounts, or cancelling it and re-issuing it or honestly as a show of good faith and DISGUSTING customer service after speaking to 3 people all in a different country that couldn't really be understood or understand me on the same day that it was mistakenly activated (not played with and trying to get something for nothing). I have been told tough... there is nothing we can do.  So my son does not have this product he can not use this product, I paid $63 for something that can never be used and my sons level of disappoint and not understanding is heartbreaking.  He does not have his Christmas gift, it will cost me another $63 to make this right and all Playstation would say is tough!!!

Not sure why the price went up to $60 at all because the experience isnt always stellar and I dont see any improvements worth $10 more per year from their entire base.I do appreciate the free games although most of the time they arent typically games I would like to play and i still prefer Sony to Microsoft for now. Other than that you’re going to need this to play with your friends on playstation so i can especially recommend these when you can find them for $40

Playstation plus is a bad value. You hand over your money, and in exchange Sony.. does what? They don't host game servers (most games are still peer to peer.) They don't provide any updates beyond what non-paying customers get. The free games are almost always worth less to me than the monthly subscription cost. They don't provide any connectivity (I already pay my ISP for that.) What am I getting here? You're letting me play multiplayer? It doesn't cost you anything to do that! The only reason it's even possible for you to offer that is because you so tightly control the available software! Shame on Sony for emulating Microsoft's terrible anti-consumer "service" model (have to put service in quotes because no actual services are provided.)

If I could give it zero stars I would. I bought this as Christmas gift for my son along with a PS4. I activated the membership on my parent account. I don’t play video games but I have a parent account to have parental controls over my sons account. I had no idea what I was doing and there was no support or warning that if I activated it then my son couldn’t use it. I contacted Sony support and spent hours trying to get it transferred to my sons account. Escalated to a manager but no luck. They said tough luck. Even though you bought it for your son we cannot transfer it to his account. Even though I never used it. It is a total scam and turns out the benefits aren’t even worth it even if you can figure out how to set it up right. It is a total scam. Save your money and buy your kid a real game.

I opted to buy this through Amazon rather than Sony in order to avoid automatic resubscribing with Sony. Doesn't work that way, you'll be automatically re-upped regardless (Sony requires a credit card as part of activating the code). Now I've got the worst of all worlds: when I entered the code into the PS4's redemption spot, I got some message saying the network was too busy, check back later. Now the code won't be accepted at all. Sony customer support chat is, apologies, total poop. Not sure how I'm supposed to return this to Amazon either, and if I'm able to, I suspect that despite not be able to access the Sony network, I'll be charged again next year for this absence of service. Total poop. If you're going join up on Sony's network, just do it through your Playstation.

Not much to say about this one.  You get the code very quickly, it works, and I have another year of PlayStation Plus.  I have downloaded hundreds if not thousands of dollars worth of free games in the PS store as a member, which in my estimation makes this very much worthwhile. Of course it also allows for online multiplayer, but I almost never use that.

If you want to enjoy all the perks of gaming with friends and stranger online, this is a must get!Most triple A titles require a PS Plus subscription account in order to access the full Online Multiplayer Features of those games on the PS4. And in order to do this you'll have to purchase a temporary membership access pass.
This code not found, pls helppThis problem is the first that i had

My wife bought me this on Black Friday last year. She assumed it worked automatically. She didn't realize I'd been paying $10 month for online access. She just recently saw the card in our 'order history.' She told me about it, so I went to activate it..... Claims it's expired even though I never used it. Total RIP OFF.
This is a stupid product don’t buy it they don’t actually email you a code so I got ripped off DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!

I was saving it until I  ran out of ps plus and when i decided to renew the code wouldn't work. I contacted Playstation and they told me to fix it with the retailer aka amazon. It sucks because this never happened before but i definitely won't be buying these again from amazon. I only got it cause it was a great deal at the time. But that's pointless if I cannot redeem it.

This is the easiest way for me to add a month,  quarter or even year of membership to PS Plus without being billed automatically after the time period expires (as if I do it on the PSN). I also like how Amazon gives you a discount for being a Prime member (granted, it was only $0.04 but probably more with a larger purchase such as a year membership).Additionally, I received the code lightning fast (good, since it was an "e-code") and the instructions that came with it provided a very clear-cut way to redeem the code. This is important as many times I have had issues finding where to go to redeem a code but this removes all uncertainty.

Painless way to buy if you cant get to a store.  And the discount when i got this in Amazon is not to be missed (it wasnt offered in PS Store when I got this in Amazon)  if you like the freebies that comes with being a PSplus member.  The one year is so worth it! Freebies like Metal Gear: Phantom Pain is so worth it! Always keep an eye on sales like Black Friday... Amazon thank you!

As per the headline, I bout one of these thinking I could use it when I had some free time and could do online interaction with my PlayStation Friends.  When I tried to input the code, it was expired.  So I had to buy it again.  Don't get me wrong, it works when you enter the code, but I figure since I paid for it they got my money and the things shouldn't expire.  Nice not having to look in stores for these.
The Sony PlayStation customer support is awful.1) you can't call from many mobile providers without getting an error because they block VOIP numbers.

Not much to say, it's a three month PS Plus membership. Had no trouble activating.But of course if you have a playstation network account with billing info on it, it will still default to automatic renewal, which I was looking for ways to possibly avoid at the time of purchase. But it IS easy enough to disable auto renew if you're in my boat and don't have the stability of budget to support that, at least it is on PS4. Just go to Settings > Account Management > Account Information > Playstation Subscriptions. Select the subscription you want to cancel auto renew on, and select "Turn Off Auto-Renew".

I don't k ow what people are complaining about but I bought this last night and the minute I submitted my purchase I gor my confirmation via email within one minute. I followed the instructions to enter my digital code via the website. I logged in and then enter code and Waddabing!  I'm in within two minutes of my time. This saves me mulah and saves me time..Pros: cheap, easy and fast (like my ex)

The PS4 Plus card that I purchased through Amazon provides online gaming action, so that my grandson can play games with his cousins and friends. Purchasing the card through Amazon was very helpful because I can instantly attain the voucher number, add it to my grandson's PS4 gaming console and away he goes! I think the instantaneous availability of the voucher is what I liked most about my purchase.I cannot think of one negative aspect regarding the PS4 Plus card, nor the purchase of it. I would recommend purchasing the PS4 Plus card from Amazon to enjoy gaming right away.
Ppl dont seem to know how to redeem  the code, what is more sad is that even amazon customer service dont know either..Follow steps below slowly you wont miss it.....

Nothing beats instant, so when you want to get on the PlayStation Network now, this is for you. Because some folks purchasing this item may not be owners of PlayStation devices, to clarify this is a digitally redeemable code. These are used to provide a single PlayStation gamer with access to the PlayStation Plus network, which is essential for the PlayStation 4. The PlayStation 4 requires this membership to fully utilize the multiplayer capabilities of the console.Once you've provided payment info, you can be online in just seconds after purchase. You could even write this code (delivered on screen after purchase) in a card for a sneaky way to deliver an awesome gift to the gamer in your life!

My son has his own ps4 and wanted to renew his playstation plus membership, but the ps4 kept rejecting all of my debit/credit cards, so I got clever and found that I can do it through Amazon.After you purchase the membership Amazon will email you the voucher code that you can then take and input directly onto your ps4 through the redeem codes section on your ps4 (google for more help.)

"The code you entered is inactive. Please check terms and conditions." This is the message I get when trying to redeem on PSN.I bought a couple of these about a year ago...my advice is that if you buy these cards, REDEEM THEM RIGHT AWAY to make sure they work.

Purchased two codes today and one previously. Email came within minutes with my codes. Was able to redeem them via my online account instantly. The codes will stack, so I’m covered for two years now.**If you purchased more than one code, redeem sooner rather than later. I have heard these expire within 12 months. Once they are added to your Sony account they don’t expire and the years stack. No need to wait a year to activate the next code.

Please note before you purchase this item: BE PATIENT and WAIT for your code to go through before you try to redeem it on your PlayStation account. It will go through, it just takes a little time because it's going through Amazon vs directly from SONY (which if you buy your 12 month sub during Days of Play you -can- directly purchase from the PS website usually for the same price of $39 eliminating the issue of waiting on a code to be sent to you). If you try to grab the code and immediately redeem it then it's going to kick back a redemption error on you because Amazon is still verifying through their services that it's a legit purchase/code versus blindly flinging whatever code at you. It's to cover their butt and make sure YOU get what you paid for.That being said any other errors received after waiting a while to redeem can indeed be legit errors but I'm seeing a lot of people complain about not being able to redeem their code right away. Yes, it is instant but it's not like going to the store and buying a card with a code that's already been verified as legit, Amazon/SONY have to make sure there's nothing weird going on. Just be patient and your code will come through. :)

I'm not 100% certain how to review this. It's a 12-month PlayStation Plus membership code. You buy it and get 12 months of PSPlus. I would recommend it for the cloud backup alone, but I guess there are some other perks too (like free games). In any case, you buy this and Amazon has a little spot where all of your digital codes live (same spot if you buy a game or other digital codes). You find the code, enter it, and call it a day. My code worked fine, no complaints.

Super easy. Save a few $$$. Looks like at the right times you can save a good bit. Had my code within seconds of buying, typing it into Playstation store redeem section immediately after no problems. You'll receive another email after your order that will have a link to take you to your amazon games and software library. Click it and log in, there you can view your code to enter into the PS store.

I only purchase my playstation plus memberships on Amazon.  You save yourself 10 dollars versus buying directly on the playstation store and it really couldn't be much easier to use.  All you have to do is purchase the card on amazon, then go to the plastation store and directly on the bottom left you go to the redeem code option.  Type in your code and you have officially renewed your playstation plus.  I would highly recommend this.

This is just a solid deal. I've been PS+ since its inception and the monthly free games are my main motivator. But I use the other features too. Always try to get it on sale though--unless you are desperate and forget to re-up during Black Friday and you have a game date with Lisa that you need to use PS+ restricted features, then go for the full price. Missing out of memories with friends isn't worth the $10-15 bucks you might save.

I'm only getting this code because it was on sale, and I'm tired of paying full price for my PS+...after I saw some of the reviews of people not getting through to the code after paying for it, I was a little bit hesitant. I decided to take the hit and when I saw the code in my library, I was a little bit reassured, until I entered the code into my redeem code from the digital games library. Instead, I just opted to redeem though PlayStation and entered it that that way. It was a gamble for sure but I'd much rather take the gamble and pay much less than 60 for an online feature and other little stuff that SONY has to offer.

Now PS+ is absolutely amazing, it does a number of things right and a very few things wrong. The instant game collection always has some of the highest quality games on the market. Lately we PS Plus subscribers have been getting hit games such as Metro Last Light, DMC Devil May Cry, Bioshock Infinite, Brothers A Tale of Two Sons, Payday 2 the list goes on. This subscription fee has already payed for itself it has saved me numerous amounts of money, I now am getting games I've been wanting to purchase for some time.So you pay 50$ you get numerous amount's of high quality games, it definitely sucks when you already have said game so I can be hit or miss at times. When I first subscribed I kept getting games that I had purchased a year ago and started getting sick and tired of the service, 3 months later the subscription is now paying for itself at this point. You will also being getting extra discounts on games, indie games, DLC, wallpapers, themes and etc.... Some of these discounts can range for 1$-15$ which is pretty nice at times. You also get a few freebie/ such as wallpapers and themes that are pretty cool. And now you have the option to play several games for 1 hour to decide whether the game is for you or not. You also have cloud storage and the ability to turn on automatic updates which will update all of your games which is pretty cool and it will update your system.

use things like this to get your kids to do stuff. Annual subscription? I want an annual subscription to "I took the trash out dad". They can get a dollar to take out the trash once a week. Seems almost reasonable for a trip to the trash can. Doesn't it? OR, sweeten the deal and pay $60 for an annual sub. No more hassling mom/dad. Occasionally they will need extra ps4 bucks for special events. That can cover the extra heavy trash weeks. everyone is happy. Should work on spouses too. Pay each other for chores. no one's coming out ahead financially but you'll get your chores done.

I suppose the high incidences of days are what make this purchase difficult. Initially I tried purchasing a 12 month PS plus membership from my PS4 device. I couldn't. So I logged in on my computer and again tried. It was again denied. Ironically I had purchased 3 games on this same account using the same credit card over the previous 5 weeks, including the day before. So next I tried buying this card from Amazon. Again the purchase failed. So I bought another item on Amazon to test the credit card I was using. That purchase cleared just fine. Next I called Amazon.I would rate this purchase experience a 5 star because of Amazon support but because I could not purchase the card and didn't know why the transaction remained in pending status, I am giving it a 3 star.
I bougth a code that didnt work, when I contacted to Sony they answer that they couldnt do anythingbut Im already without my Boucher or my money

My paypal account was hacked in march 2019 from someone in the UK, one of the things stolen, amongst others, was someone ordered some games from the playstation store. I had to change all my account numbers, and Paypal had to research each transaction.Well lo and behold, the next time I went to play on my PS4 I was greeted with a message saying my account was banned for violation of their service agreement. After some lengthy time on the phone, the rep from Sony basically told me im SOL, the only way to free up my account was to pay for that idiotic rugby game and movies that paypal reversed the charges on, even though my identity was stolen.

Purchased this for my brother..It was Stuck in Pending Purgatory.. for several hours. I didn't receive any kind of confirmation , and it didn't show up in my orders..So after an hour I tried it again.. same situation..This time when checking orders the item did not show up until I set the filter to last 30 days. Of course the previous two gift card orders showed up so I now have four gift cards when I only meant to get two. I finally called customer service they deleted the orders asked me to re-upload my credit card. It was complete hassle... so I re-ordered it at 9 p.m. and it didn't come out of pending until 3 a.m. the following day. I don't know what the issue is but it's obviously something that occurs to a lot of people so next time I need to get gift cards I'll just go to a brick and mortar store since take about the same amount of time to retrieve it.

$29 for a year of PS Plus? The best deal EVER. After getting screwed with XBOX Live Gold - I actually had to close a credit card because they wouldn't stop billing it after I repeatedly called and ask them to stop - I thought I was done with online game console services for good. When they announced that a paid PS+ subscription was required for online play with the PS4, I was annoyed. Not really mad, since I don't play a ton of online games, but every once in a while it's fun. I started digging in to PS+ and found out about the free games. Holy crap - that's when it made all the sense in the world to sign up for this.First off, a PS+ membership spans all of your devices, so one membership works across your PS4, PS3, Vita, and PSP. They release multiple games for each every month, and the titles are just getting better and better. Recently Tomb Raider 2013 was released for the PS3. Resogun is still one of the best games on the PS4. Outlast on PS4 is easily worth the price of a year of PS+ by itself. Bioshock Infinite and Borderlands 2 on PS3 last month. Uncharted 3 on PS3. The list goes on and on.

I've been using PlayStation plus since 2011 and I love it! Buying the 12 month card/code is the best value because a $40 12-month code breaks down to only $3.33 a month! I stock up on the 12 month codes (over 10 years worth of codes) when the price drops down to $40 because every few years their price has raised by $10. The regular price now is $60 for 12 months but before that it was $50 and before that it was $40. They're all so great to give as gifts and I've done that quite a few times.

I bought the code from Amazon during a deal (even though I already had subscription) so that I can use it later whenever I want.But when I tried to use it (after about 1.5 years),  it says the code in inactive.

When PlayStation Plus first came out it really couldn't compare to Xbox Live. Now that several years have passed this is good if not better especially when you compare it with Xbox Live Games with Gold.While I do enjoy playing games with friends online. I really like getting several games each month for free on the PlayStation 4, PlayStation 3, and PS Vita (for a while you even got free games on the PSP).  Even though some games are really lame, some are triple A titles that I have not had the opportunity to purchase myself.  I really like this feature of PlayStation Plus

Hopefully you got it for $40 during the November sales! Its a steal. Playstation Network is always better than Xbox. Thought download speeds aren't as fast but not everyone has a 20MB connection. Come on face facts if you really wanna game internationally PSN network is your best bet..its community is even better and larger than Steam. Playstation experience is seamless. Glad I sold my Xbox never trust Microsoft again. Remember what they did to Zune, Windows Phone and Nokia?? This company Microsoft can pull the plug any moment its not trustworthy. Sony is making profits only because of Playstation and they will stick by it. Happy to game on PLAYSTATION.

Amazing How quickly i received my Code,  Amazon is quick with the response time and no less than 10 minutes it was sent to my email so as soon as I purchase the e code I received it almost immediately in my email and it worked like supposed to. If you're looking for a quick easy way to get a gift card for PlayStation this would be the way to go the response time is profoundly good .

Long story short, you'll receive 2 codes; one in email to redeem on the PS Network, and one in Amazon Digital items to redeem that way...  I ordered this on Amazon because of Sony's long history of being hacked and losing credit card numbers. The order on Amazon was easy, and I went into my Digital items to retrieve the 12 digit code. When I entered it into the Playstation Store, it reported "this prepaid card has already been redeemed"; this comment thread has many similar messages. Fear not. When I looked at my email, I saw a different 12 digit code and that one worked fine. I guess that Amazon has a special code and wants you to redeem through there system, so that they'll have access to your PS account for all time or something like that.

One thing I'd like to point out is that when I was redeeming mine, it said it expires on I think the 19th or something (about 7-10 days from when I bought it)If you are actually buying this to use later, I'd suggest not doing that...the people who said they bought it and tried to use it months later or a year later...well...codes get generated, people try to use code generators to steal codes, if you don't redeem it, someone else might...and on top of that, it may just expire too,

Having to pay for this service is laughable why would I ever play anything on playstation that isnt exclusive? With this service it makes every online game more expensive. Why would I play borderlands on ps4 when I can pay 60 once on pc and be able to play it forever online.Once we get screwed over by not having net neutrality you would have to pay 4 different payments (3 of them reoccurring) to be able to play an online game on ps4.

Service was orgasmic! Transaction was complete under in 30 seconds. The playstation network has problems from time to time, but who does not. 10 out of 10 would buy again next month and then the month after that assuming xbox doesn't start offering a superior product.

PlayStation Plus is worth the price alone for online game backups. I've been a member since it began and it has saved me several times after system failures or upgrades over the years. The free games each month are just icing on the cake and more than once I've gotten one free that I was planning on purchasing anyway, or discovered gems that I've gotten dozens of hours of play from.The digital code on Amazon is the best way to buy. Retail price is a bit steep but it periodically goes on sale during the big shopping holidays so if you can pick it up then it's a steal. Even if you are a current subscriber it will extend your subscription by the purchased amount.

The description is an absolute lie. "Instant delivery" is what you get when you use the PSN to add a PS+ subscription to your account. If you order from Amazon, you will likely wind up waiting a full 45 minutes before you get your code.I spoke with Amazon Customer Service about this. They lamely tried to tell me that my payment has to be processed before I would receive what I paid for.

I have always bought this 12 month membership, ever since I owned my first PS3 all the up to my PS4.  I like the free games you can get each month, which makes it well worth the cost.  However, if you let the account expire, you loose all those games, until you re-up that membership.The one big thing I do not like and why I give it three stars.  In order to play online now, you have to have Playstation Plus.  I don't like that.  When I buy a game, like Overwatch or Fallout 73, I should be able to play online with or without the Plus account.  Like I said, the only draw back.  This is the reason for the three stars.  I would give it 4 or 5, if not for this.

If you were on a budget you could just pay for this membership and play the many games that comes with it and not be without games. They add a lot of good games (I find for me I find something interesting every few months) to the point I have a huge backlog now and am starting to worry if I'm going to fill up my PS3's hard drive (I've only been a member 5 months now). Also, you will always have access to any "free" games you download on PS+ as long as you are a member. So if you need to stop paying for a while (and aren't playing the games), you can pick PS+ up later and get access again to all the games you downloaded before under PS+. Think of it like Netflix but you get to play the games offline as well, no internet required to play the games you get (just internet required to obtain them and probably also every time when your sub runs out you'll need to connect once to let the game license know you are good for another year or so <- you can stack years).Also, if you have a Vita, I really can't stress that you really should subscribe. It seems that a lot of the best Vita games make it onto this membership (I've gotten Gravity Rush, Wipe Out, Uncharted, Rayman Origins all on it and that's just the Vita specific games, not even including the PSP games like GTA Tales of Liberty City. And I know Persona was on it at one time as well as Assassin's Creed).  Bad side of being a PS+ member when you have a Vita? You're going to want a large memory card of which those are super overpriced :(. But if you wait good deals come around (well at least deals that make the cards more reasonable). Like I just picked up a 32 GB for 40 bux.

I've been using PlayStation Plus since 2013, and I've always been happy with the service that it's provided. Getting the Free Monthly Games, and the increased Cloud Storage for saved games is really nice. The added benefit of membership is that PS Plus members can get an additional cost saving during special sales throughout the year too. The 12-month membership is the best deal too, because it's about half of the monthly subscription cost.If you're a gamer on the PlayStation, this is a must-have purchase. This is especially true for any game that requires online multiplayer, as the service is a requirement for some online gaming titles.  I'm very happy with my purchase, and I definitely recommend it. Two thumbs up!

I took a few of these while Amazon had them on sale for $39.99 , a great discount from the retail $59.99 price! I play on my PS4+PS3 a couple of hours almost every day, so I think it's a great way to get free games and discounts.Unless you're a heavy gamer, you might not find real "value" on this membership, except if you want to play online.

I bought the product back in November 2017 because it was a good price and I would eventually need to renew it.  I tried using the code 11 months later and it says it will not work.  I guess I will need to notify Amazon in order to get my money back almost a year later.  Not sure how that is going to work. Very displeased!!!

PSN has been one of the most dominating platform on the market of today since the release of PS3 era. Not only does this come in long way, but it also contains one of the most exclusive games included with its subscription. You're paying for a 12 month membership with discounted games and addons for being a member of the Playstation community. The code works flawlessly and I enjoyed playing many games upon the platform that Sony allows me to!

I purchased this product for a European Playstation account, and it is apparently unusuable for those not in the United States. Apparently it is also non refundable or transferable to a European account. So I have wasted $60 on a digital code I can stare at and be angry about. I want some compensation!

The product is just as advertised and I find it much easier to purchase and redeem than in the PS Store. Also, I got it during the days of play promotion in June for 40 bucks, which is a steal in my opinion. The only problem really is that Sony when you buy a product in a gift card or through amazon, immediately enrolls you in their auto-renew feature for the full price of 60bucks and will automatically charge your card if you have one set up in the PS Store. Therefore, don't forget to disable this immediately after redeeming, so you are not forced to buy this again if 12 months down the line if you find you are not playing much while also assuring that you can grab any of the discounts that regularly take place. The mere existence of this default auto-renew feature makes me deduct a star.

I already have PlayStation Plus on my main PSN Account, but decided to get 1 month so I could play multiplayer for my other main PSN account. PlayStation Plus Subscriptions come in intervals of 1 year, 3 months, or 1 month.  I wasn't able to find the 1 month trial at my local store so luckily Amazon.com had it.  All I did was search PlayStation Plus, the 1 month membership came up and I purchased it.  The PSN was delivered immediately to my email address, and within seconds I was playing online. I might buy another one before the end of the year.  I only play a couple of games online, I like the cloud storage, and free games you get...which are great some months. Highly recommended for those who don't play online always and just want to test things out.

I mean, it's exactly what it says it is, a 1 month subscription to PlayStation Plus. This won't be reviewing the benefits of having Plus or any of that. This is purely rating if it gave me a one month subscription, and it did. 5 stars because it's exactly as described.

I've had Playstation Plus for almost a year now, and it has been well-worth the money that I spent on it. You get access to 1-hour demos of games, cloud game save storage, and discounts on various titles. However, the best part is that you get a large selection of free games every month. Some previous and current titles include(d) Uncharted 3, LittleBigPlanet 2, Sleeping Dogs, Binary Domain, etc. You'll easily get your money back on the purchase if you enjoy playing games. Each month games are rotated in and out, but they will be accessible to you as long as you download them to your account and have a current Playstation Plus membership. If it runs out, the games become deactivated, but will activate as soon as you renew your subscription. You can also delete the games if you're running low on hard drive space and re-download them at a later time, even if they are out of the current rotation.I have both this and Xbox Live, and I much prefer the overall benefits of Playstation Plus. One thing that Xbox Live has that PS+ doesn't have is cross-game party chat. Aside from that, I find PS+ better in every way. Microsoft has just started giving a few free games with Xbox Live, but nowhere near the quantity and quality of the games offered on Playstation Plus. Playstation Plus membership is cross-platform, meaning if you have an active subscription, you can get free Playstation 3 games and free Playstation 4 games. They do not have separate expiration dates and you do not need to subscribe twice.

I purchased this code for my son.  When I tried to use the code, it says inactive.  So, I contacted Amazon. They told me they could not help me and that I should contact Playstation.  So, I contacted Playstation.  They said they cannot help we without a serial number from Amazon.  I provided Playstation with the voucher code that Amazon provided to me.  Playstation said that they need a serial number from the card.  So, I contacted Amazon again and they did not have any additional number to provide me.  They said I should contact Playstation.  This is quite the fraud they have going here. They bounce you back and forth for hours with no help and of course digital codes are non-refundable.  I can't believe that a large company like Amazon sells items that they do not stand behind. If it doesn't work, well, you are out of luck.  DO NOT BUY THIS FROM AMAZON.

PlayStation plus a simple service for PlayStation Network users to boost their gaming experience and library. When you subscribe for Plus, you will immediately notice the extra benefits. First, you get deep discounts on a many PlayStation Network titles compared to regular users. When Sony-owned titles (practically any exclusive to PlayStation) have an upcoming beta, PlayStation Plus users are called on first to try it than the general public. Finally, every month you have the chance to download full titles to play on for the remainder of your PlayStation Plus subscription. If your membership lapses, you simply cannot play the titles that were downloaded for free.PROS:

PS Plus is hands down the best deal in gaming. PS4 now requires a Plus membership to play games online however, Plus gives out at least 2 free games per month ranging from indie titles to full games like Sleeping Dogs, Devil May Cry and Bioshock Infinite. The best part (for someone who owns all three) is that the membership carries over from PS3 to PS4 to PS Vita so you don't need to shell out $50 per system.I've heard that Xbox Live has recently started putting out free games twice a month but honestly, PS Plus makes a mockery out of their service. PS Plus offers a great selection of Indies as well as full retail games digitally that are more on the recent side of the timeline where as the majority of the games Xbox Live offers for free are 4 and 5 years old.

If for some reason you can't purchase PSN credits directly from your PS3, this is an excelent alternative to do so. Pay exactly what it costs, Amazon gives you the code, enter it at the Playstation Store and game away. Thats it. Brilliant stuff.Now, about Playstation Plus, anyone who is serious about the time they spend gaming will find a lot of benefit from subscribing to Playstation Plus. Though I must say the $50 subscription is much more cost effective, but if you feel like getting a taste of what Plus has to offer this 3 month subscription is alright.

Any PS3 user should have this. It's such a great deal, I can't even lie about it. Playstation Plus is the near equivalent to Microsofts "Xbox Live" but with a TON of perks. You get access to a nice handful of free games every month, ranging very nostalgic ones like Crash bandicoot, to even the newer games like Dragons Dogma. They call this your "Instant Game Collection" because every free game goes into your account, and you basically build up your 'free game collection' the longer you are a member! And all you pay is $50 for a whole year! On top of that, you get great discounts on newer games, access to automatic updates, 'cloud saving' (Saves your games to the cloud, so you can play your saved files on other PS3's, or if your PS3 breaks, you still have access!) and Free FULL GAME trials (Play a game for an hour for free!). There's almost no reason to not get this, it's such a great value!Also, PS4 users are 'required' to get this for online play, but at that price and that sort of value, I wouldn't mind at all!

First time buying ps4 online membership. And the code worked as it should. Didnt wait 15mins like most reviews say if they had trouble redeeming the code.Always buy my xbox gold membership on here too, never had a problem with the code whether the 3 month or year.

PlayStation Plus is a must if you have any PlayStation system, not only do you get to enjoy the online multiplayer experience, but the service also offers free quality games each month for each of their systems, meaning that it quickly pays for itself and more, this as well is coupled with discounts and other small goodies. I've been a Playstation Plus member since it first started and have accumulated many "FREE" games where the membership has more than paid for itself.  This was during the PS3 era where online gaming on that console is free.  Now it's a requirement to have a Plus membership for the PS4 if you want to game online.  That's a minor con but this membership also includes games and discounts across the Playstation family of hardware: PS3, PS4, Vita and PSP.  The other thing you must understand is that these "FREE" games are only free and usable as long as you have a membership.  Once that expires your games will not work but any purchased games, including the discounted Plus ones, will still work since they weren't given to you at no cost.  The best way to utilize the service is to purchased it when it's on sale as I got 2 years worth last year during Black Friday and have a membership for a number of years as it stacks onto your current SEN account.

All cons I should not have to pay for online gameplay since I already pay for internet service. I understand PlayStation needs to make their money but plus membership should be reserved for PlayStation monthly free games and exclude restricting online gameplay unless you have a plus membership..

I've been meaning to try PS Plus for a while.  I had bought the $199 250 GB Lost of Us Pack on Black Friday as I needed a PS3 for my room, which came with a 7 day trial and I saw that Grid 2 was a free game.  I probably would have spent $30-$40 on a new disc copy, anyway, so I got a year.  I've barely had it a week and is already well worth it.  Free games added, great discounts on games & content, plus 1 hour game trials so you can try a game for an hour straight if you're thinking about it.  Plus Playstation Memories is free for members on the PS3.  It appears you can put game saves in a cloud for use on multiple PS3s.  I didn't do this in my house, so I'm not entirely sure.  I do different game saves on both my consoles.  The games & content is what really drew me in and now I'm just getting several GBs worth of content on my PS3 every week for free or for an inexpensive price.  I had little desire to invest in a PS4 and PS Plus makes that decision even easier now.  For a reasonable yearly fee, I get plenty of entertainment on my PS3.

I specifically bought Playstation Plus subscription because when I got my Vita I knew I wanted to get Uncharted and Gravity Rush.  Those two games alone covered the cost of my subscription and where free at the time of my subscription.  The games that you get through Playstation Plus is amazing and WELL worth the money and is an excellent gift to give someone who owns a PS3 or a PS Vita.  All the games you download/"purchase" you can play for the entirety of your PS+ subscription.  If your subscription ends you can't play those game (the ones you bought for "free") again.  BUT if you get a PS+ subscription again you will be allowed to access to all your prior games you have downloaded/"purchased" in your past PS+ subscription.  Basically make sure you "purchase" all the free games you can because you can play them at a later date when they are no longer listed on the PSN as free for PS+ subscribers.  This way you will have a constantly growing library of digital games that you can play at a later date at your leisure.

Last year I purchased a PS Vita Bundle that came with 3 free months of PS Plus to try out.  I was very skeptical about the subscription, but I was willing to give it a go.  Thing is, I loved it so much that I purchased a full year when my 3 months expired.  Sony does a good job of routinely putting great games for free each month for my PS3, Vita, and now PS4.  Well, only a few games for free on PS4 so far, but if my Vita and PS3 are any indication, I think Sony will continue the trend.  Thing is, my game purchases have dropped significantly, so it has definitely saved me money.That being said, keep in mind that PS Plus Subscriptions stack, so you can purchase multiple subscriptions and enter all the codes at the same time and the months will accumulate--not sure if there is a limit, but I purchased another year subscription this year during the Black Friday sale where you got a year for $30.  Definitely a steal if you can get this on sale.

I am lucky my membership expires every year at the same day as black Friday and to be able to get it at $39.99 every year instead of the full price is even better, I do use it once in a while for online shooting games, it takes away worries or any stress that i may have during the day since I concentrate on the games, online gaming makes me forget about everything else, so this is a must have item. I'm sure there are features of PlayStation Plus I haven't used yet, but I'll go over the ones I do use.Free games - There are, at any given time, about 10 or 15 free full-length games available digitally to subscribers. These are changed regularly and have included big names like Street Fighter, Darksiders, Mega Man, Little Big Planet, Ratchet and Clank, etc. You could amass a pretty decent collection just in free games, especially if you're a casual gamer. You only get to use those games while you're a paid subscriber, but the price makes it well worth it.

I've seen a few reviews where people claim that this doesn't work, but after trying it I'm inclined to believe that they either were experiencing technical difficulties on their end or they may have been doing something wrong without realizing it.  I purchased my code while at work and was able to get the code instantly, I wrote it down as I would not be able to try it until I got home about an hour and a half later, but when I did get home and entered the code it worked fine instantly.Also, for anyone upset about the $59.99 version of this product, I did a little research and it seems that Sony did increase the annual cost of their 1-year memberships to $59.99 in general sometime back around August/September 2016, so it appears that stores such as Amazon and Best Buy who still have some of the $49.99 cards/codes in stock are still able to sell them alongside the new/more expensive ones until they sell out.  So if you want to save $10, go ahead and get your $49.99 1-year cards while you still can.

For an avid Playstation user, getting the PS+ seemed like a no-brainer decision.  You get a nice selection of free games each month (top favorites from the past include Battlefield 3, Uncharted 3, Ratchet and Clank: All for One, and Darksiders), excellent discounts on PSN games to buy, free trials on some of the hottest new games, the ability to conduct automatic updates, and many more bonus features.The value gained from the 12-month subscription of Playstation Plus definitely exceeds the asking price in my opinion.  The free games each month alone will certainly add up to the price, even if you don't own the rights to the actual game after your subscription expires.  In most cases, you'll be able to play the game as long as you want and complete it without having to deal with buying the game and then trying to resell it back.  Another factor to consider is how PS+ will be integrated into the next-generation PS4 console, allowing users to play online.  By purchasing your 12-month subscription to PS+ now, you will be able to transfer that over to your PS4 if you are like me and plan on getting the new console as soon as it is released.  Therefore, allowing instant access to all the great features mentioned above along with the rights to play online right when you get your PS4.

A truly great service.  While it is mostly meant to get you to buy newer games at a discount, the amount of high-quality free games offered is astounding.I've gotten everything from Final Fantasy, Infamous 2, Little Big Planet 2, Bioshock 2, classic Sonic games, the Simpsons arcade game, and so much more over the last year for just $50.  Yes, you have to maintain your subscription to play them, so they are more like rentals - but still, any games I intend to play years down the road I'll buy a physical copy of, and I don't see myself not subscribing as long as my PS3 is my primary console.

After getting it, I have no regrets. There are a lot of games to download. Your real issue is going to be conserving your hard drive space. The additional features include; online game saves so you can play your saved games on other playstation's, automatic download of selected games and game patches, and other stuff I can't recall right now.Get it if you plan on playing your playstation for another year.

Theres no reason you should be paying to play your own games online. Why would I pay extra to play on a lesser platform when I can play online for free on PC? Makes no sense to be paying extra to use something less.

Nice and cheap! Works great, got emailed the code within 30 seconds. be sure to cancel your subscription once you put the code in if you have a card on file on PlayStation plus. If you don't, they're going to charge you full price after your card expires

It was like $20 off the normal cost....why wouldn't I get this?  Also, I accidentally deleted the email containing the code. I wrote to Amazon and after they checked to make sure I did not use the code, they emailed it to me again.  Put the code in and BAM!  One more year on playstation plus

This product is great if you are a PS3 hardcore player or just a regular gamer on a budget. Think of the PS Plus subscription like Netfilx, you're essentially renting games for as long as your a member. Every two weeks (or so) you get free games. These could be full retail releases like Resident Evil 5, Bioshock 2 or Little Big Planet. They also offer free "arcade" games like The Walking Dead, Super Street Fighter II and Costume Quest. Since being a member I've acquired so many games, that I just don't have time to play them all. You won't probably like all the games you get, but you get such a variety and so many that you're bound to get your money's worth from this. It's an absolutely great deal especially now they're including PS Vita games.Spend the money on this item and you'll have no shortage of games to play for the whole year - for only $49.99.

How do you review what is essentially a gift card? Its a better value to get the 12 month over the 1 or 3 month, so I guess there's that.As for the service itself: Do you want to play PlayStation games online? Then you need this. (and you get a few free games each month for as long as you subscribe).

Did this product meet my expectations....Well yeah, I need it for online play for PS4, its like being asked by the IRS to write a review after I pay my taxes... I liked it when they used to give away indie games for PS+ instead of the stuff they are giving away now. Bulletstorm? No Thanks.

I like how easy it is to receive the code, and how easy it is to apply to my playstation store account. It is even great as a gift just copy the voucher code and text it to whoever you are buying the gift for. That simple.

Ps plus is must have. I’ve got great games for free in 2018 such as inFamous Second son, Metal gear solid V... and looking forward to Playstation do the same in 2019. And also multiplayer is amazing.  this deal happens only once a year in Black Friday, so get it before its too late.

Arrived instantly, i literally paid, and typed it in ps4 which took maybe 40 seconds and it recognized the purchase and code. Great deal to not have to put credit card info into psn since they had that hack years ago. Not like amazon would be any safer but in less systems the better. Plus didn't have to drive to the store. So not a special like $10 cheaper sometimes at bestbuy but i didn't have to leave home.
Renewal worked great, with cheaper price.  THANKS!

Unless you play online, this service is no longer worth it. It used to 9ffer great games for free every month. Now they're really bad games or just cheap indie ones. Not that indie games are bad, it's just ps plus is no longer a good value like it used to be.

This was easy to buy and received a very prompt email indicating it was ready to be redeemed however there was a bit of an issue redeeming. The instructions were to click the redeem from PlayStation and it would redirect you to the PlayStation site and the click the confirm button once there. The issue was once I was redirected to PlayStation there was no confirm button it was asking for the redemption code which was not given. After a quick call to Amazon they were able to provide the code. Still very happy with the purchase

I was hesitant about purchasing Playstation Plus.  I thought it would be a waste of my money, but I have been proven wrong.  I own many PS3 games and figured that this would be a waste of my money.  I have been so busy with many of the free games that are offered I don't find myself getting bored with my game selection.  I also own a PS Vita and it is nice not having to go and purchase a ton of games for it because I just use the free games from PS Plus to keep me entertained.It is also nice to turn on your PS3 and see that your updates for the system and for your games are already done for you in the middle of the night.  You don't have to turn on your system and wait for it to update before you get to start playing games.
Code worked fine. Not sure why there are so many bad reviews

Amazon should get 5 stars for how easy it was to purchase and redeem this 1 month PlayStation Plus membership. I have rated the product 2 stars with regard to the value and the undesirable pressure to subscribe to a service just to play a game with my son that is overseas. My internet, EA's servers, my PS4, I don't require a discount or subscription to keep 'free' games, there's no real value in it to me. It's just a toll.
Buying this gift card was a good alternative to entering my payment information directly on my PS4. It was also a good way to decide if I liked the subscription.

Got this for $40, as a deal from $50.Don't play many multiplayer games. Get this (and share this with a friend) mostly for the 2 free games available to members each month.  Last month, there was the first episode of King's Quest (revamped and reimagined from the old DOS title).  It was wonderful to play with my kids, and caused me to buy the full game.
Great deal. Got 12 months for $8 more than what I normally pay every 3 months. PS+ is a must for me. I don’t play multiplayer games often but the free games and cloud storage is super necessary.
purchase this so that my son's friend could play with him in another state and it was so easy to get the code and send it to him within minutes of purchasing he was able to play with my son.

Great price for under 40 dollars, down load was quick. Sometimes it just takes time looking for the cheaper cards. Ridiculously priced at 60 dollars. Sony should be ashamed charging faithful members those prices. Definitely a good price.

This is a good deal. We only have a PS3. We have gotten quite a few games, but the downside is that I have not played most of them. I think that the reason this can be such a good deal is that most of us have so many games that we don't play most of the ones we have. Also, you don't get to choose the games, so some games will just naturally not be interesting, and when prioritizing your time you won't choose them. The uploaded saving feature is a good idea. I have lost save data because of hardware problems on the PC and on the GameCube (GameCube games on the Wii), so having a backup is a great idea. The discounts and the Playstation Store are also great.
Bought this as a gift for my daughter who is away at college. Never knew you could buy it online and use it elsewhere and then found this. It worked great and she was extremely happy.

It's a great deal if you can grab this on sale, instead of paying the recurring fee. Especially since Playstation Plus no longer gives PS3 or Vita games in 2019... If you don't play games online and require this service, consider dropping it completely, as it doesn't add much to your PS4!
Worked fine for me. US region only iirc. It's better if you just buy a yearly subscription, paying $10 a month isn't really sustainable for what you get.

This is something that I wish I didn't need to play online. But since I've activated it, my engagement within the PlayStation ecosystem has grown. For $50/year the value is actually there. There are at least 6 free games per month, sometimes more.I got this on sale for $35. If you have more than one PS device (PS3, PS4, PS Vita) then this is a no brainer.

More affordable than buying a 12-month PlayStation Plus membership on my PlayStation and since most of my games require having a membership, I will definitely be purchasing this again. :) Very satisfied with this buy.

PS Plus is one of the best values in gaming. When I first subscribed, my only PS console was a Vita. Even with just the handheld, PS Plus was an incredible value. I recently added a PS3 as well since I was able to buy and restore a broken console very cheaply. My PS plus account carried over to the PS3 at no additional cost and I've added a lot of games to my library without buying anything. I currently have a PS4 on preorder so this will extend even more benefits to me at no additional cost. In short, if you have a Vita or PS3, PS Plus is a no brainer. With PS4, PS Plus will actually be required to play online multiplayer but even if it wasn't, you'd be crazy not to subscribe. The $50/year pays for itself many times over.
Fast, easy, convenient, and secure way to renew membership. This is the only way to do it, as there's no way anyone should trust PSN with payment info given their insecure hack-prone history.
Good price for the Online Service, if we also count that each month they give away two Plus Games.
I was hesitant about purchasing from reading some reviews about it not working. I  received the code immediately, redeemed it through my playstation and it immediately worked. No issues at all!
Make sure you use it sooner than later or it will not work when you enter it and Amazon not Sony will step up and do the right thing.

What's there to say about a virtual gift card for the PlayStation Network? Not much I reckon, but Amazon's AI has determined that this product is a good one to review. The code arrived quickly and was accepted by PSN without trouble. Best of all, there was no paper to recycle.

I was a little worried to buy this online. I read a lot of reviews about the codes not working. One review said to wait 20 minutes before trying the code. I waited about 30 minutes after buying the code to try using it. It worked great. My son was able to log right into his account and the online service worked immediately.
But this on a cyber Monday steal for under face value and although I’m glad to have saved the cash it was quite a hassle to redeem and in the future I will continue just buying them in the store.
My kids used to ask me to drive them to the store to pick up a membership card. I love that Amazon offers a digital version. My kids  receive the info they need immediately after purchase.

I do not like that this is a recurring charge that was not mentioned before I purchased it for my grandson. I don’t have a Sony account to stop it and I can’t stop it on Amazon.  The only thing I can do is change my card so that it will not automatically recharge. Which means I will not be purchasing anything on Amazon until I decide of I want to share another card with them! Can’t even reach anyone to complain about it!!!

This was a good Black Friday find - 20 bucks less than the usual 60 for an annual membership. It takes about 10 minutes for the code to show up in your Amazon account, but once it does, you very easily add it to your Playstation account. This added a year to my existing membership.
Didn't work. Wasted my money. PSN wouldnt refund my money not would Amazon. Not happy with the online purchase of this product. Buy in store or not at all.. you have been warned!

The perfect gift for any avid PlayStation fan.  It allows them to connect online for multi-player games and it offers monthly access to some select titles that PlayStation selects.  At the discounted price it's a no brained for the gamer in your life.

Got this on cyber Monday for $39.99 for a whole year.  I got the email verification minutes later.  I waited till Christmas to give this to my son.  I held on to the Voucher code till then and we had NO problems activating the code.  It was super easy.  Will for sure buy another on Cyber Monday again.

Had to order twice.  1st one they never even processed for some reason.  Customer service had no idea why said sometimes it takes 4 hours.  4 hours for a digital gaming code.  That's a lot.  2nd one worked fine but took almost hour to get processed.  If your in a hurry, would not recommend.  If you have time, digital code worked fine.

So I was not sure about getting the full year subscription and I wanted to try out the program. I saw that they have a three month subscription so I decided to try that out.I was able to grab free games every month as well as use the online servers for online multi player. I also got to access the discounted items and the PlayStation exclusive games and programs.

Very good price for the year subscription. Previously, I was paying per month for PSPlus, but heard about this sale from a member in my gaming Facebook group and quickly ordered it. I got the digital code and booted up my PS4 and went to the store to redeem. Worked flawlessy. Will definitely purchase yearly subs from Amazon again, because around that time will be Black Friday. :D

I got this when it was on sale for black Friday, but would pay the normal price every year. Honestly the year is the number one choice here, you also get some free games and access to most of PlayStation network. Needed for PS4 online gaming.

At first I only had my only Vita and the plus was barely worth the money. (3 months for 17.99) But with access to my ps3 and vita, the plus is amazing. (49.99) One big game a months for the ps3 plus random minis, older games, and indies. The vita really only has the same big games on it since I got plus a half a year a go, but gets a few minis or a psp games here and there. Really it's more like a nice bonus.If you have a ps3 with a hard disk that's at least 120+ gb you'll get your money's worth. With the vita, it makes the vita more then a paper weight, but if you only have a vita or psp you better really want the games in there instant list or its not worth it.
I got worried for a moment, I thought i just spent 60 and didnt get the code. Apparently you get 2 emails and i was looking at the wrong one, one of the emails will tell you the code :)

Get free games and online gaming capabilities when you buy this nonsense. Just do the smart thing and buy this only when it comes on sale. No need to pay full price of $60 every year. These memberships come on sale quite often.
I bought this card for my son so he can play his PS4 online... It sucks you have to pay to play online, but if you can catch these cards at a discount, you might as well jump on it.

Personally I only buy these if I'm broke. The best value for your money is the 12 months version but if your strapped for cash but wanna game online, this is a good buy until you buy the 12 months version. Its ok and pretty easy to redeem so enjoy.
Our son always wants a Playstation card for his gaming. So, this is the easiest cost effective way for us to buy one online. We get the code instantly and he can then add it to his account.

Having a 1 year subscription this affordable takes a load off of me. Through of the year, sometimes it can be a bit of a hassle having to keep purchasing a new card or reloading one and this totally takes all the pressure of having to remember to do that after every three months. I would absolutely recommend this product to someone who plays the game frequently.I purchased this product from amazon.

Giving 5 stars based off value at the time of purchase since I paid $45 (even then, why?). I think the full price of $60 for a year is expensive given the fact that games are already expensive and the 2 free games given a month are not even new games.

Purchased it while there was a sale going on. Getting a digital PSN Plus membership through Amazon is the easiest and most simple ways to get your activation code. After purchasing your 12 digit activation code is in your digital locker and redeeming it is a breeze easier than driving to the store and getting a physical card.
Sons Christmas  gift, I got on sale so it was worth it.  easy to use no problems at all.  I will buy every year, since it is only for 12 months.

Glad this went on sale. My subscription wasn't up till April so was nervous about buying it now and it resetting my subscription date from now(December). But it just added a year to the end of April, so it expires in 2021..

Even though I love the Playstation 4 console, the only fallback for it is that you have to have a Playstation plus membership to play any of the multiplayer titles on it. A big drawback because on the Playstation 3 console all of the titles that are online multiplayer are free to play as lomg as you have the game disc. Did not find this out until I bought the Playstation 4 Destiny bundle and could not play online multiplayer, which that was what I was anticipating the most out of the game. Oh well, leave it up to Sony computer electronic arts company to hit your wallet more and more.

It’s a bit confusing at first. After waiting over an hour to receive my code, I finally went into messages and found out that the code is sent through the “thank you for purchasing” message. So I didn’t have to wait even 2 minutes for it. Then I plugged the code into my console and worked fine without a problem.
The games it lets you download are garbage. Not really worth the 40 dollars if you don't play online games.

Paying for online capability on top of paying your internet bill seems silly but Sony has been adding free games and more features to the mix since PlayStation plus was introduced. It help keeps the PlayStation alive and ensues you get the best online experience you can.
I got this for my 16yo because he ran out and begged me as he was unable to play Fortnite or Overcast with his friends. Keeps him out my hair for a while.

PS+ for 20 less than usual? Absent the days of PS3 when the network was free, this is about as good as it gets. Enough said. If it is the same price as buying it on PSN, then be more seamless to just buy it there because you will not have to enter the code.

PS+ membership gets you online play access, which is nice, if you can find anyone that wants to play with you.  The real benefit is the free games every month.  Some of the games are demos, others are older games, but all of them are free.  That means in just a couple of months you've paid for the membership with free games and all the other benefits are just gravy.
Code came instantly,. Took a while before the code was ready on Sony’s end though so couldn’t redeem immediately. Purchased @ 11pm worked the next morning by 9AM

I purchased this when it was $39.99 even tho my current plan doesn't expire until next August. For the price you cant beat it and now I don't have to worry about renewing for a few years in the case the price goes up next year. Digital code worked perfectly.
After paying for the card, I received the confirmation email within 2 minutes giving me my code to input into the PS$. Worked great the first time without any issues.
The code goes right to my email as soon as I hit that purchase button. Gives me the ability to play online against the scrubs that like to camp and call themselves amazing.

This is one of the best things that has happened to my PS3. My PS3 has been an over powered Netflix machine for the last few years, and now I am finally playing games on it again. You get ~4 games a month just for the PS. Not all of the are AAA titles, but all of them are fun. If you are looking for a way to get new releases for free*, then this isn't your subscription. but if you want to play a bunch of games that you probably never would have, check this out. Also, the auto/ overnight updating alone is worth the 50$ a year. all the games you have played will update over night so you don't have to wait 30+ minutes every time you want to play something.

Love PlayStation, although I’ve been a gamer since ‘85 and there never was a charge for Sony gaming.  Seeing as the is now.  Being able to get my credit to pay to play from amazon is nice.  Basically I don’t have to leave the house!  5 stars!
Received fast and worked no issues

If you are going to do this anyway, might as well do it at a discount. You don;t have to apply it right away and can leave it in your digital items with Amazon and apply when needed. Or, I think, you can renew it any time and it just adds 12 more months to whatever time you have left.
I mean it's just a card with a code on it to get PlayStation Plus. I do like however that you can get the code through email, I thought that was pretty sick and efficient.

I've been on ps+ since it started. the normal price is more than what was offered here. I think they call that a sale or discount or something. So I bought this code to add to my ps+ sub. Now I'm good for another year or twelve months. Whatever.
Worked perfectly. I got code and entered it and boom it worked. Nice price at 44.99 even though I think online gaming should be free as long as you buy the game and no additional subscription needed.

I bought this a while ago now I want to use it, you get 5 stars if you can tell me how to find my code in the Amazon appI found it, google “ Your Games & Software Library” and log in, click the clickable text in the instructions. Here are your 5*
Quick Delivery of the code and it worked no problems

Not sure how so many people are having problems with this, it's pretty cut and dry. Buy it, activate it and you're good to go for another year. Just in case anyone is wondering these do "stack" meaning if you buy 2 and activate them at the same time or have time left on your current PS Plus membership, they will kick in one after the other.

This was the cheapest I’ve found anywhere!  My son needed to renew his PS membership and Amazon came through perfectly!  We were able to instantly put it on his account.  He loved that he didn’t have to wait for me to go to a store and I loved the price.
You can't buy this in the store anymore, well, at least where I'm at.  Didn't have any problems with it.  Wrote down the code and put it in the kids PS4 and everything worked well.  Will buy again.

It was time to renew my membership and for some reason the PSN will not associate my card with my address.  So to rectify this situation I purchased the membership from her (it does charge tax which surprised me).  I put the code in on the PSN and I was up and running for another year.  This is a good option if you have kids and don't want to store your CC# on the Playstation for unauthorized purchases.

Playstation plus basically pays for itself from the amount of games you get for free.  For $50 a year, you're getting free games every month for all your Playstation products.  I "download" all the free games whether I'm interested or not.  Once you get the games, you have it for as long as you have a subscription.  I grab them all just in case a develop an interest in the future.  If you end your subscription and sign up again in the future, your purchases and free games come back as long as it's the same account.  The Playstation Plus discounts are also a great benefit.  The amount of content you get is just worth more than $50/year.  If you own a Playstation, you should get Plus to enhance your experience.

It worked fine, no problems. But I'm confused. On the amazon and ps store site this was fifty nine ninety nine, but after checkout on the ps store reedeem code input it read as fourty nine ninety nine. Is this an error on sony? I think I saw this a bit cheaper on another vendor, this is pretty expensive but whatever it works.

Code was attached to the order email confirmation. Simply added code on to my account and now have 12 months of ps plus service. Very Easy and quick. Plus the cost  compared to paying monthly is a 50% savings.

Definitely worth your money. You receive at least 2 games every month to play for free as long as you're signed up for the service. Some of the games are old but many of them are fairly new games which would cost at least $40 bucks.You also get discounts on other games and movies. Some tv show episodes you can download for free as well to give you a taste of what the show is like.

PlayStation Plus is a definite benefit for gamers and even causal players. As a member from June 2012 the value is just that, real value for the price of less that one new 59.99 game you get free games for your PS4, PS3 and PS Vita for an entire year.As a PS Plus member I was able to discover games that I would not have normally heard about or played that turned out to be personal and family favorites, we sit, stand, scream, jump, shout, gasp and laugh when we play our PS Plus free games.

Me gusta este producto y lo uso de vez en cuando, para el playstation plus, de mi PS4 PRO. No soy de jugar mucho online. Pero está, en muy buen rango de precio. Me sirve bastante. Satisfecho en la velocidad de compra digital. Gracias

Well not to badly priced but I remember the days of playing free. But them days are gone. Granted you get some perks with this I got a few free games with being a plus member. They do change it up from time to time so you get different games. I was able to backup most of my saved game data to the cloud when I upgraded the hard drive. That way you don't lose it all. I still had to download all the other data such as games, addons etc.

PS+ has changed me.  I am now a better person.My level of anxiety has been decreased.  I used to live in constant fear of loss.  My last PS3 died and took much of my save data with it to the grave.  NEVER AGAIN.  Because now I have cloud saves, and they are the best.
Not bad for $45 but I wish we did not have to pay to play online.

What's there to say about this?  While I'm not exactly happy that Sony requires us to have PS+ in order to play online with this console generation, PS+ does have its benefits.  You get anywhere from two to three FREE games each month, more if you have more than one Sony console, and you get to play online with your friends.  The free games add up and they're usually anywhere from $5 to $15, so I think within a year this pays for itself in free games alone.

For a LONG time i didnt think PS+ was worth it. I thought it was just a money grab, BUT let me tell you. PS+ is AMAZING, it is WELL worth it to buy. If you have a PS3, PSVita and PS4 you will be getting 6 games for free each month. Yes, people think of it as a "rent"(because went the subscription is over and you dont renew you cant play those games anymore until you buy PS+ again), but if you continue to pay, especially with PS4(because you have to pay to play online MP) you'll have those games and continue to get more games all the time. There have been SOO many games that i didnt get when they came out because either i didnt have the money or it didnt speak to me right away, i am now loving. GET PS+. it is a must buy

I honestly can't believe I've been blindly (stupidly!) paying $10/month instead of paying $44/year for the same service.  It was always taken directly out of my account, so I never really noticed it but when I saw this price for a year, I knew I was paying more than that and jumped on it.

The only reason why I'm giving four stars out of five was because the email with the code took a little long to be received (about 2.5hrs). I'm used to getting faster response times. Had me a little worried but it is legitimate.

It worked fine for me. I put in the code as soon as I got it I still had eight days oh my last subscription. So it says it expires in a year plus the eight days from my last subscription I had no issues while putting in the code

Buy digital, get code in 2 mins then I am back to playing. I recommend you enter the code directly in the PlayStation store then on your PC. Never tired it the other way but heard it sometimes does not go well.

Purchased at the Christmas discount. Would never pay full price.  Not sure how I feel about it fully because I haven't done much to take advantage of it. Hopefully the monthly free games will be worthwhile.

Buying this was cheaper than paying sony online so it was a no brainer for anyone who is a plus member and want to renew.  You can even buy early and extend your membership.  This is a digtal code so nothing is physical sent to you.

Got this on sale was the best price I have ever seen for this 12 month subscription.  I purchased 2 entered them on my PlayStation account to extend out my account for 24 months.  These stack on your current membership so pick them up when they go on sale.

Pretty straightforward. 1 month of PS Plus. Received the code in minutes. Cheaper than buying through the PlayStation store. I got it so I could get Friday the 13th for free through thier promotions. Satisfied customer here!

I was nervous because of the great price and the idea of getting an emailed code, but it worked great.
