I have had PlayStation Plus almost from the start of the program, and it has just gotten better an better each year.  Not only do you get awesome (and I mean, really awesome) games for FREE, but you also get great discounts on other games and/or DLC.  I cannot recommend PlayStation Plus enough to all my friends and family who own a PlayStation 3 (or 4).  Right off the bat, you get 12 free* games to download to your PS3.  There is a caveat, the games are free only as long as you are a PS Plus subscriber.  In my case, I don't even worry about that, because I'll be a PS Plus subscriber as long as it's around.

All I can say is that it's required for online gaming.  The plus side is I purchased this while Sony was offering 3 months of Netflix for free.  so I purchased this and my Netflix subscription is free for the next few months.  It actually saved me more money than I paid for this! HAHA
This is the fourth year I have purchased play station plus membership for my 16 year old grandson.  He rates it five stars with a big smile on his face🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

A little expensive by itself. You do get a free game monthly. I do wait till they are on sale and purchase them. You can save the code to put in later or they will just extend your subscription an extra year if you put it in immediately.
Its nice to be able to buy this and have it delievered electronically within a couple of minutes! PS Plus provides the capability to play online games and also gives free games every month.

I've been a Sony fan and PS plus subscriber for years because the free included games are great. Well worth the $30 price tag on BF.  Free games + discounts = huge savings!PS+ is well worth the purchase for anyone who uses PSN. I had to buy it through Amazon because the PS Store won't accept my credit card. One again, leave it to Amazon to save the night. The best part about it is how easily you can claim the code - 2 clicks and it's all done!
Mandatory requirement to play online games on PSN. $60 for a year is worth the 3-4 decent games you get for free. The rest are usually garbage.

I like paying as I go and I think it's cheaper on Amazon especially when there are specials going on. It takes about 10 mins to get your code and Amazon will provide you a link on how to activate it or you can just go to your Playstation to activate it. Very easy. I would do it again.

It would be easier to use my card for this because it negates the extra step of having to come to Amazon.com to make this purchase.Still, it works and my subscription expiration date has been pushed a year forward since initial activation.

Great value if you want to have a subscription based gaming experience. I do not care for having a bunch of game boxes laying around, or do I care about playing games right when they launch. This service has provided me with enough free games to build a decent backlog (I game roughly 10 hrs a week on average). The quality of the free games are wonderful, I have only experienced a handful of them over the past 2 years that I have not personally enjoyed. If you own more than 1 PS system (I own PS3 and VITA) there is no reason not to own PS Plus.
The code worked and I received it fast. I would recommend this product to anybody who needs a to buy a gift card subscription for ps4.
Received code just seconds after purchase, digital code worked first try when entering on the playstation store.Everything went great.

Pretty standard PlayStation Plus membership. 5 stars for the $40 Black Friday Deal on Amazon. Membership is pretty much mandatory with most games on PS4 (or at least to get the most out of them) so this certainly lessens the financial blow a bit. Buy 2 if you can!

Best deal ever on Amazon!! Beats buying from PlayStation Store for $59.99. Instant code delivery after you buy and I use right away on my PS4 when I got the code so it works for me! Til next year renewal again. No regrets!

I always here horror stories about stuff like this not actually working however mine worked like a champ. My husband's free trial expired and he needed to buy a membership on Christmas day. It's  a gift card.  How much of a review do you need?  It worked.  I get 12 more months of online play and mediocre free games.

If you own a PS3, PS4, or Vita, it's worth the purchase. Obviously after the year is up any of the "free" games you've downloaded will not work, but it's worth the investment to have for the sole reason that there are new games each month, and some that are worth having in an instant collection, such as Sleeping Dogs, Borderlands 2, Bioshock Infinite, etc.I bought this during the Black Friday for a discounted price of $29.99. Regularly it's $49.99. When my subscription ends around Thanksgiving, I'm sure this deal will pop up again, so it's worth noting that because it's a pretty good deal. Like I said, if you have any of the systems I mentioned, it's recommended ( with a PS4 it's needed if you want to play online. )
I like how you can get free games on ps4 and I've made alot of good friends with having this. So thanks and ps4 keeps getting better and better every day.
Been buying this from Amazon for yearssssssssCode is always delivered within the hour, most times its within a few minutes though. Never any issues and always a good price.

Since this gives you free games every month to add to your collection, including AA titles and indies, it is easily worth the money if you aren't someone who buys games right when they come out. I don't think the PlayStation Plus discounts are that fantastic, but 10% off is better than nothing. If you own more than one Playstation device (Vita, PS4, PS3) then you will get even more value out of this membership since you only have to have one membership for all devices. I wish that Sony would take away the PS Plus ads once you subscribe, but that is my only complaint.
Fast easy and got the code right away

For starters the PlayStation Plus service is great, just got Uncharted 3, DMC and Bioshock Infinite (3 games I was planing on buying) just for 50 bucks a year, I mean for that money you'd just buy one game, and if you don't care having it only in digital it's the best deal ever.I got my code in 5 minutes tops, a great alternative for those who don't have a Credit/Debit Card from the US. And you get stuff for the PS4 and PS Vita too (well there's not much for those yet, but you still can see the holy word "free" floating around)
It took some time to figure out how to upload this code but my 13 year old figured it out.  It's nice to have live-in tech support.

PS Plus is a great program if you own any sort of Playstation system (PSP, PS Vita, PS3, and PS4). The only things I will warn you about is the fact that you should go for the year subscription if you are serious about using PS Plus, for it will save you money in the long run. Also make sure you have plenty of hard drive space, because Sony gives plenty of awesome free games each month for download! With just this 3 month pass (and only a month into it) I have gotten 5 free games, each of which cost anything from $15 to $60. YOU WILL NOT BE LET DOWN BY THIS!

Saved $20 by purchasing on Black Friday, and will definitely do this every year.  Was due to renue in May, and this just tacked on 12 months!  Had a moment of horror when I thought I got a bad code, only to realize I typed an "o" instead of "0"...... my bad, worked great after that fix!
So for years I have always bought this in store for my son, but opted to get try the digital code as it was cheaper. It worked perfect with no issues.
If you're like me, and don't want to put your card info into PSN (after what happened a couple of years ago) then this may be a good option for you.I will continue to purchase plus through amazon.
Just as described. Received codes immediately and was able to redeem them at the same time. Purchased during Black Friday sale.

This is one of the best things you could own for your Ps4 as it gives you access to special deals and free games each month. It also gives you access to play online games and sometimes they give out free add-ons to some games you just have to keep an eye out.

When PS Plus first launched I purchased a year and did not get too many great games that fit me. Now that has changed on PS3 you get at the time of writing Bioshock Infinite free! That is a AAA title that is a must play in my opinion even if you do not like Bioshock 1 or 2 like I did. This is ironically more favorable for gamers who own both PS3 and PS4 as opposed to just a PS4 as the games that are free on PS4 are mediocre. You also have Uncharted 3 currently to download for free and Borderlands 2. Hopefully the trend continues with AAA games every 2-3 months which would make it reasonable. I stocked up on Black Friday. You can also get them cheaper through some auction sites.

This is probably the #1 best way to buy these. I'm too lazy to go to a retail store and buy them. Not only that, I do not trust SONY to have my credit card information since they have already charged me twice when I never purchased anything (apparently it's an automatic renewal of the membership). I purchased this, immediately received my code, and plugged it in to the "Redeem Codes" area and reactivated my membership. It's so easy and convenient to use, and I'll be buying more of these when I run out.

I am not into memberships or subscriptions, but my brother recommended this, so I looked into it.  I have been hooked since.  In my opinion this is a great value.  The free games every month pay for the membership.  I originally thought that the free games would be lame, but they are not.  I have been playing almost every one of them.  Even if you do not happen to like the free games, the discounts are tremendous.  I have not bought a hard disc video game in about a year, and with all the free games waiting for me on my hard drive, I am not sure when I will be buying another one.  Ok, well, maybe I might just buy Assassin's Creed IV Gold Edition, but that is probably about it.
Instant gratification. The key number is both in my digital games area and came in an immediate email. Five minutes from ordering, I had a confirmation from Sony when I used the code.

This 1 year PS Plus Subscription was on sale which made it cheaper than normal which is a definite plus. I ordered on my phone and was worried about how to transfer to my son's PlayStation. It was easy to enter the codes that were given with the order.  Nothing to worry about.

When I tried to redeem the code at the playstation website,it kept saying the code was inactive, I almost gave up resigned to the fact that I just threw away $60. I decided to give it one more try by reedeming it directly on the console and it worked. I'm not sure if it was an issue with the playstation network website or what. So just redeem it on the console and save yourself the frustration.

If you have a PlayStation 3, Vita, and/or PlayStation 4 and don't have PlayStation+, you're doing it wrong. The number of quality games I have on my backlog that I've received via PS+ is embarrassing in its excellence and scope. Of course, on the PS4, you'll need PS+ to play online (not the case on the PS3 or Vita), but that's very much a side consideration for me, not being of the online playing ilk. Membership pays for itself inside of a month or two depending on how many devices you have. If you have all three systems, this really is a no-brainer.

Whenever you can get these at a reduced price, grab them.  You can stack up the digital codes and use as each expire.  I believe I have had tremendous value out of this, finding at least six of the free games that I have downloaded for free to be exceptional.
I don't like giving my credit card out to a lot of different companies so this is a really convenient way to pay for my yearly membership without giving Sony access to my credit card information

I hate to have to pay for the service, but the code that I received was authentic which is the most important part to me. The monthly "free" games are fun, too. (Free is in quotes because technically you're paying to receive them).

For the price, even at retail, I have no complaints about the service.  The free games for my Vita and PS4 are great - if I had a PS3 I'd really be set (a lot of AAA titles for the PS3 over the last year or so I've had this).  I've been pretty happy with the sales they offer plus members as well.  You do lose access to the free games if your time expires (purchases stay with you) but I don't plan on cancelling any time soon.  Memberships also stack so if you find a good deal it's worth grabbing a couple. The code purchase itself was easy and I was up and running in no time.

Got it on sale, but even at regular price having the chance to download new games each month makes the membership a good value.  I suppose if you are a hardcore gamer who wants to be an expert on one or two titles, this may not be for you.  For a casual gamer like me, who likes variety and who doesn't mind a little bit older or less popular games, you can get more "play" for the price of a single top-tier game.  As the description says, though, if your subscription lapses you lose the ability to play those downloaded games until you renew again.

It is okay to have if you want to save money on trying new games. However, the games you download will stop working once you end your subscription. Some of the games offered on PSN aren't that good. But the games that are good will be worth the money spent for the year. The games you get are actually yours, even if you stop the subscription. Once you start it up again, you can access the games you downloaded in the past.

It sucks that Sony's started charging us for subscription to play online with our friends but hey what can you do, went I heard Sony was going to raise the prices of the subscriptions I bought like four of these just so I wouldn't have to pay 70 something dollars for a yearly subscription of PSN.

First time trying a digital code for playstation plus, and it works swimmingly.  Also, according to the PlayStation Christmas sale, we got fifteen months instead of just twelve, so that was pretty cool.

Great price! Code came within mins of purchase. We had tried to get a digital code from Walmart but after waiting more than a month for the code we finally got it refunded. I was a little hesitant to get another digital code but this worked just as advertised. We will be purchasing this again next year.
Theres not much else to say, bought this on Cyber Monday, received code via amazon, entered code immediately on ps4, code worked

What can I say, it was a great deal.  I intend to keep my subscription going indefinitely anyway, so always nice to save ~$15 when doing so.
It's a year subscription to ps plus. Not really much to say about it. I always suggest wait to get it for less than msrp. I paid 40 which is fantastic for a year subscription to ps plus.

Bought this as a gift for a friend who can’t afford the subscription price. Got it discounted and couldn’t be happier.

Playstation Plus is amazing.  For $50 a year (less if on sale) you get access to the instant game library. If you have any Playstation device you would be a fool not to have this.

Discounts, free games on three different platforms every month, and automatic cloud back up of your saved games. The PS+ membership is worth the $50 a year and is practically a steal when the $30-40/year membership promotions are going on. Whether you are a casual or hardcore gamer, Playstation Plus has something for you.Besides cloud save and weekly discounts, it offers wide, rotating catalogue of games for its members. For the price this is a great service. First, I love the auto updates, I sit the PS up so that it update late at night when I am asleep. Second the free games are amazing. It does stink that we have to pay $400 for a system, $60 for controllers and games and another $50 to play online for the year, but Amazon really made this one easy. For as long as I have owned my PS3 gaming has been slow, now you may think, really? (After all there are many AAA top notch games to be had on the system). The problem were not the games, but rather the time it used to take me up to save for them. I averaged 2 months or 4 for a new game purchase, granted I unlocked almost all the hidden characters, trophies, challenges, you name it.Enter PS PLUS, I bought the $50 USD annual subscription you see here and I have not regretted it, now I have access to more games that I have the time to play, almost all of them fun experiences of varied genres, games like infamous and its sequel, along with multiplat blockbusters such as bioshock conform the roster of over 20 full PS3 games I have been able to download as part of this subscription, and I have not even been part of it for half a year.

Playstation Plus, if you have a Playstation 3 OR a Vita, or even better, both, is very worth the price. Every month Sony adds games to the service that are offered for free. Big names on PS3 are inFamous, Littlebigplanet, etc. Big names on Vita are Uncharted, Gravity Rush, Ninja Gaiden, etc. In addition to new free games every month, PS+ subscribers also got a lot of great discounts on PSN sales. For example, Sony recently had a sale where you could get one year of Sony Music Unlimited (their subscription music service) for just $12 as a PS+ user. There are some other minor features, like cloud game saving and automatic downloading of updates that are just the icing on the cake. Unless you already have most of the games offered for free, this deal is perfect and will completely pay for itself in all the great deals and content you get. Even if you do have some of them already, more are added every month.

What can i say about about this item? It's a great deal for 12 months of free games for your PS3, Vita, and PS4. As long as you continue to have a PS Plus subscription, you can play any games that you downloaded in the past even if it's no longer available through playstation plus. So it's a good idea to download games that are on playstation plus ASAP before they are no longer available even if you don't plan to play that game for a while. The games they offer are pretty good and they rarely offer cheap or outdated games. There were many instances where I bought a game for full retail price only to have it available on PS plus in a couple months such as Soul Sacrifice, XCOM: Enemy unknown, Dragon's Dogma, Borderlands 2, etc.. Also, with the Ps plus membership, you can buy games for a heavy discount that you keep permanently. For example, after only a couple weeks after Muramasa Rebirth released on PS Vita, it was on sale for PS plus members for over 50% off. Now with the release of PS4, you need this membership to play online games. PS Plus is a great value for your money and I believe you don't need to buy any new games as long as you have PS Plus membership. So it's great for parents that buys their kids new games every month for 60$, and instead they can just buy this every year and enjoy countless AAA quality games.
You can’t beat convenience.  You can purchase online and they will send the code directly to your email.  Also not to mention you can’t beat a really awesome deal.

I'm not talking crappy games (though some are) but big releases in some cases, older big releases but top games none the less.  Even if the game doesn't appeal to you, grab it anyways and give it a try.  It's free and who knows, you may like it.

Buying into Sony's online access to play all your fun online games like Overwatch, Fortnight or Call of Duty also gives you access to lots of free games every month. Most free games aren't necessarily the most fun, but within 2 or 3 months you'll have a library of 18+ games, and at least one or two will be really fun. Regularly, Sony offers other benefits to their PS+ members with extra discounts during their sales. So between the monthly free games, access to play online stuff and the discounts offered, this membership is a must buy for any PS4 owner, and a pretty good buy if you're still just using PS3 or Vita.

I bought my first year through my PS3.  On there, you have to go through their strange, somewhat laggy store, and choose what you want, then type in your name, address, and credit card number, using the gamepad, ONE LETTER AT A TIME.  But then you get the service, and it immediately becomes worth it.  I have around 10 to 15 complete games, that I can play for free, while my subscription lasts.  And not crappy games, either:  I have Uncharted 3, Bioshock Infinite, GRID 2, Hotline Miami, DMC: Devil May Cry, and a bunch of others.  Binary Domain also came out, which isn't "good", but it's more "unbelievably insane", which makes it somewhat good.Amazon had this on sale on Black Friday, so I bought it.  Then Sony's servers melted, because LITERALLY EVERYONE was trying to redeem their code at the same time!  But, when I was able to enter the code?  TWELVE CHARACTERS!!  That's it.
Worth it because you can download games for free.

In the past PS3\PS4 Plus membership was revelent only if you wanted to play co-op game play.  Today Play Station Plus offers far more than access to co-op play.  I like the ease of storing game stats and progress information online.  I like the free games you get.  You get just enough free games in a year subscription to make the $50 investment pay off in my estimation.  The Sony Playstation Plus membership is not forced on you with the heavy handed big brother threat, fear and fire wall function feature barrier tactics used by other gaming systems.Sony has a better system in the PS4 and it also has a superior incentive driven system that for my money appears more friendly and customer centric.  My Playstation Plus experience last year was so much fun that I gladly re-enlisted in the Playstation Plus army once my first tour of duty was up.  I found a partery $50 a small price to pay for all the fun moments Playstation Plus Membership gave me over the past year.  I don't usually go in for value added services because; they are usually short on value.  I am not a co-op gamer being autistic I have few friends to game with online.  I love video games but, I have cerebral palsy, autism and other disabilities so my game play skills leave me barely able to survive in the easy games.  Hard video games I leave on the shelf forever.  Playstation Plus gives me additional ways to enjoy video games I am able to play.  Playstation Plus gives me games I can play FREE or at steep discounts.  Playstation Plus lets me preview a game which lets me see if it is a game I can play even with my disabilities BEFORE I sink big money into buying the fully unlocked version.

Playstation Plus is basically Xbox Live. You buy the card ($50) and you can play Playstation games online. BUT, there is an added benefit. You get around 6 games a month for free! PS4 games so far are just indie games as of right now, but they're generally decent. There is typically a AAA quality game thrown in with the PS3 selection as well. Great buy overall.

If you own a Playstation system that can access the internet (beofre the PS4 at least) then you already enjoy free online gaming access. This membership on top of that brings so much more to the table. With it you get discounts for being a member on various things store wide including games, movies, tv shows and music. You get exclusive early access to lots of demos. You get access to game betas long before anyone else. Lastly, you get a crap ton of free games. This membership was the main reason behind my buying a PS Vita. After 7 months being a member I had more than 15 Vita/PSP games downloaded on my PS3 and no handheld to play them on. I also received several choice AAA titles for free. Within the first month of being a member, the amount of free games I received more than paid for the membership. What I would have paid for those games new at retail or or downloadable would have easily cost me 4 times what the membership cost. If you have a PS3/Vita/PSP or upcoming PS4 then you should have this. I playin all gaming sandboxes (Wii/PC/Xbox 360, etc.) and this value easily trumps Xbox Live in which you get none of these perks with a gold membership.

There really isn't much to say here... You cannot go wrong with buying a PS Plus membership... Period!For $49.99 you get over $1,500 annually in free games in addition to the many discounts on additional items. You receive AAA titles like Bioshock Infinite, Uncharted 3, Tomb Raider and many more yet to be announced. You also get access to a wide range of independent titles for free like Contrast, Dead Nation, The Puppeteer and Resogun. Your membership also covers your PS3 & PS Vita (if you have them) and you'll receive new titles each month specifically for that device.

When my nephew received it he kind of turned his nose up at it (he wanted a particular game instead.) However, once he actually booted up his system and entered the code he discovered several free downloads available. Since Christmas I have gotten several texts and phone calls telling me how great it is to get different "free games" each month... and when NBA2K14 showed up on a free download in May he about lost his mind. Here's my opinion on Sony's "Playstation Plus" subscription. I really don't like the fact that they said membership will "always be free". To me, membership means that you get ALL the perks. That being said, if you don't play for the subscription, you don't get to play online. Maybe some games you do, but the majors you won't. Of course, for me, that's not a huge deal, because I rarely play online, if ever. But that's not the point. The point is, they said it would always be free and now it's not. Don't get me wrong,...I understand Sony's switch to paid because at the same time you have Microsoft charging for Xbox Live and that's doing HUGE numbers, so it only makes sense?! Now, that's my problems with it. My LOVE for PS Plus is the FREE GAMES idea! (this also forced Xbox to add their "games with gold" problem to it's subscription). The free games and discounts alone are worth the money for the subscription! It also runs across all Sony platforms!

I have hesitated in having to purchase something "subscription" (i am cheap when it comes to that), but I purchased this for one main reason, it grew to more once I had it. The main reason is this: For  roughly $4/month, you can automatically upload your game saved data. That is a huge deal, imagine how much time you spend on a game to get to a certain level. Even someone making minimum wage would easily go past $100 worth of their time to get to some higher level. Imagine a gamer, who has several games. As you can see, it already makes sense. So that is the main reason. Then you can download and play several games while you are a member, some games worth more than $40, I must have downloaded almost $100 worth already in my first night. So that is my "growing" reason(s). I am sure there are more reasons to come, but for anyone looking to get it, I think it is worth the money.

Got 2 years for $30 each on Black Friday, and quite seriously one of the best purchasing decisions I have made! I've gotten so many free games I had been wanting to try, am able to save game save files to cloud storage and use them between systems, as well as set the system to update automatically at night! Love itttt and I got a PS Vita a few months later and already had so many games to play for free.

It's hard to beat Playstation's PLUS system. I mean, there's always playing online for free on PC but when it comes to consoles, it's the best. $40 for a full year (on sale of course) or $50 at the most is not much at all for what you get. That's $4.16 per month when purchased at the full $50 price. That's 2-4 free games per month on PS4 alone, 8-12 games total between Vita, PS3 and PS4. That pays for itself within the first month of subscription. On top of that you gain access to the online gaming and while this shouldn't necessarily cost anything, it's definitely not a bad price since it does. Sony could charge a lot more and people would still pay so I'm cool with the current price. Even more than that, they give you discounts on games digitally which adds up to quite a bit if you buy a lot of games, movies and so on. I'm starting to ramble a bit here so I'll leave it at this: PS Plus is a great service. Especially for the low cost of $4.16 a month or less. I highly recommend it and as for the amazon sale of this product, the code was delivered within seconds.

I decided to purchase this 1 year Plus membership at my sisters recommendation. We had it for 8 months now so I can give an accurate review.  I love that you are able to get 2 free games to download per month that you can keep as long as you maintain the plus membership.  Some games are kinda cheesy, but we have gotten a few games that my elementary aged boys have absolutely loved.  Actually the most played game on our PS4 is the Tabletop Racing game that was one of the free monthly downloads.  I usually download the games monthly when they the new games are made available.  Unfortunately, I did forget a couple of times so I don't know what I missed. There is usually a title that is more adult/mature in nature, and one that is more family friendly. At roughly $4 a month, this a good deal.  I will definitely be buying an additional 1 year membership when this one expires.  I preferred buying this from Amazon so I didn't have to register my credit card with Sony.  I just had to enter a code according to the directions to activate.

I've always liked the idea of PS Plus, but wasn't sure I would use it... I was a little hesitant to shell out cash for any kind of add-on to an already-expensive system. But the more I read about it, the more intrigued I became. I took the plunge about a year and a half ago, and never regretted it. Every month there's new free content (which by itself pays for the subscription many times over), plus you get pretty good discounts on brand-new titles and DLC. There's enough content to keep you checking back at least every few days, and enough gameplay to keep you (or any other gamers in your house) occupied for months. Highly recommended and worth every cent.

I bought this when it became apparent that the free PS3 games I would get would more than make up for the yearly standard subscription price.  When I factor in having a PSP with a 32 GB card, a PS3 with a 1 TB HDD, a Vita with a 64 GB card, and a PS4 with a 500 GB HDD that I'll eventually upgrade to >1TB, it's now worth more to me than ever as free games for all of those systems make their way into the rotation (PSP games are rare these days, but not unheard of).  The PS4 free games have been slow, but it's still quite new and there aren't many games in general yet for that system.If you only own a PS4, this might be more of a 4 or even 3-star product:  it's required to play games online for the PS4 only, and as mentioned the free games are kind of thin at the moment.  But if you own a PS3 or Vita (with substantial free space on your storage device) it's probably worth the price; if you own multiple systems, it's a solid 5-star service.

PlayStation Plus is REQUIRED for online-play on the PS4, but not on the PS3. If you're going to play online games on your PS4, then PSPlus is a necessity. Nothing really to say about it as if a review couldn't describe, but PS Plus is pretty great as a service. Every month across each Sony console (PS3, PS4, and PSVita the handheld) you get free games. Yes, FREE games every single month as a PS Plus Member. Generally it's a mixed bag of indie games + some AAA games (examples: Sleeping Dogs, Hohokum, Borderlands 2, Gravity Rush, among others) that are free to play so as long as you keep your PS Plus membership. When your membership expires you'll lose access to online play on PS4, and the free games you've downloaded, but just renew your membership whenever you want and any content you'd gotten prior will be accessible again.Suffice it to say that the only thing you should be worried about with PSPlus is making sure you get the best deal, or if you're concerned with putting your credit card on the console for security reasons, having the PS Plus as a code (you'll enter it through the PS Store on the console) you won't have to worry about that.

I am a serious gamer and I have both major consoles (PS3 and Xbox 360). I thought I would have a go at the Playstation Plus network after being an Xbox Live Gold member for many years. The value I get from the Playstation plus is much better in terms of actual CONTENT. I am not taking shots at Microsoft and I certainly don't consider myself a 'fanboy'. Gaming is a hobby for me and its how I decompress. This is a simple truth.There are stunning AAA games to be downloaded every month absolutely free of charge for PS+ subscribers and the hits just keep coming. I am kicking myself because I should have done this much much sooner. As soon as Sony invests in seriously beefing up the online game play experience and reduce the wait time loading the Playstation network, Microsoft is going to be in very serious trouble. Anyone who uses gaming to seriously decompress should get Playstation plus.

I'm set till the next deal on PS+ comes.If you don't know about PS+ here's a quick run down: Free games every month! Provided you are a current subscribing PS+ member, (if you're a multiplayer on PS4 you're required to have this subscription) you'll get to play the monthly offered games for however long you wish. Xbox Live Games for Gold only offers two games, though permanently, per month. While PS+ offers 3-4 every month across PS3, PS4, and VITA.

I only have a PS3, so I am not required to buy this for online play.  Even so, I think the PS Plus membership is one of the best 50 bucks I have spent.  The free games every month are huge.  Many of the titles are games I wouldn't normally purchase, but that doesn't mean they aren't fun and enjoyable.  Plus, every once in a while you get a pretty sweet triple-A game which is awesome for people like me who bought a PS3 late and are still building their collection.  There are additional features as well (online storage, automatic updates, etc.), but the free games were the big draw for me.  With just a PS3, I get at least two games a month, working out to just over $2 per game.  For those who have a PS4 and PS Vita, there are a total of 6 free games per month which is obviously an even better deal.  Do keep in mind, these games are only accessible for as long as you are a PS Plus member, but if you find this membership as valuable as I do, you'll be a member for a loooooong time.

Worked flawlessly.  Placed order(s) ... I placed two separate orders for 1 year membership, so got two confirmation emails from Amazon.  Received order confirmation email, as well as another email containing my code and link (for each order that I placed).  I logged into our PlayStation account first.  Then clicked on the link in the first email.  It took me to my PS account with the coupon code already populated.  I clicked confirm to a few prompts, and that was it.  I then confirmed under the "media" tab that the PS Plus Membership had been applied to my account and the expiration date extended.  Did the same thing twice in a row, for a two year extension to our membership.  No problems at all.

Not bad, but PS Plus can be hit and miss. At times there are good deals, free games, etc., at other times the discounts/free games are weak at best. It's unfortunate that membership is required for online play, as this was not forced on previous PS generations. With that said, as a systems admin I do understand the cost behind online play--it's not cheap to keep servers among other things running under load. However, Sony made a mistake here by back pedaling and now handing the cost of upkeep to the players. The sales of consoles and games have accommodated for this previously, and this has never been a factor for PC gaming (minus subscription-based games), so it's odd that Sony adopted the XBox ways.

Before the price-hike to $60 earlier this year, the PS+ subscription offered very poor value, even at its' previous $40 pricing (and even at $30 sale pricing during that period imo).  I've been a paying subscriber to this service for 4 years, and strongly believe that online multiplayer should either be free (as it was for many years during the PS3 era) or at most, maybe $10 to $15 per year.  Unfortunately, the amount money I've spent on this service above and beyond that amount only makes me feel like I'm constantly subsidizing the development of the countless "free" trash-tier digital indie games that are offered month after month (after month..).  Occasionally, there are truly good to at least okay titles offered (Rocket League still stands out), and I honestly don't mind the rare occurrence that an older AAA title is included, even if I've already purchased it.  But all of these "free" games are only free for as long as you remain a paying PS+ subscriber, and so long as you go to the Playstation Store each month to "purchase" and checkout these titles (which again, is just a constant disappoint imo).  Other benefits of PS+ include various discounts on digital purchases at the Store (which I have never used, as I only purchase physical media) and online storage for game saves (which I do appreciate, but have never needed).  And lastly, I do enjoy playing multiplayer from time to time, but very rarely anymore - and absolutely not enough to justify spending $60/yr so I can play whatever game some random weekend 3 months from now.SONY (SCEA/SIEA), please closely reevaluate your current service and the value that it offers your customers, and strongly consider offering a yearly PlayStation Plus (multiplayer-only) subscription for a reasonable $10/year fee that does not include "free" games that many of us do not want, and without the PS+ discounts that many of us will never use.  There is really nothing else you could possibly offer to add additional value to the service at it's current price, that will be appreciated by all (ie, free/discounted PS Now, PS Vue, etc).
